member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IGeoHashGridAggregation
member.summary: A multi-bucket aggregation that works on geo_point fields and groups points into buckets that represent cells in a grid. The resulting grid can be sparse and only contains cells that have matching data. Each cell is labeled using a geohash which is of user-definable precision.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGeoHashGridAggregation.Field
member.summary: The name of the field indexed with geopoints.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGeoHashGridAggregation.Precision
member.summary: The string length of the geohashes used to define cells/buckets in the results. Defaults to .

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGeoHashGridAggregation.ShardSize
member.summary: To allow for more accurate counting of the top cells returned in the final result the aggregation defaults to returning max(10,(size x number-of-shards)) buckets from each shard. If this heuristic is undesirable, the number considered from each shard can be over-ridden using this parameter.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGeoHashGridAggregation.Size
member.summary: The maximum number of geohash buckets to return. Defaults to 10,000. When results are trimmed, buckets are prioritised based on the volumes of documents they contain.

member.summary: Restricts the points considered to those that fall within the bounds provided.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IMedianAbsoluteDeviationAggregation
member.summary:
This single-value aggregation approximates the median absolute deviation of its search results.
Median absolute deviation is a measure of variability. It is a robust statistic, meaning that it is useful for describing data that may have outliers, or may not be normally distributed. For such data it can be more descriptive than standard deviation.
It is calculated as the median of each data points deviation from the median of the entire sample. That is, for a random variable X, the median absolute deviation is median(|median(X) - Xi|).

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMedianAbsoluteDeviationAggregation.Compression
member.summary: TDigest algorithm component that controls memory usage and approximation error. By increasing the compression value, you can increase the accuracy at the cost of more memory. Larger compression values also make the algorithm slower since the underlying tree data structure grows in size, resulting in more expensive operations. The default compression value is 100.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.ICustomNormalizer
member.summary:
Normalizers are similar to analyzers except that they may only emit a single token. As a consequence, they do not have a tokenizer and only accept a subset of the available char filters and token filters. Only the filters that work on a per-character basis are allowed. For instance a lowercasing filter would be allowed, but not a stemming filter, which needs to look at the keyword as a whole.
OpenSearch does not ship with built-in normalizers so far, so the only way to create one is through composing a custom one

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationAlternate
member.summary: Sets the alternate handling for strength quaternary to be either shifted or non-ignorable. Which boils down to ignoring punctuation and whitespace.
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationCaseFirst
member.summary: Controls which case is sorted first when case is not ignored for strength tertiary. The default depends on the collation.
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationDecomposition
member.summary: Setting this decomposition property to canonical allows the Collator to handle unnormalized text properly, producing the same results as if the text were normalized. If no is set, it is the users responsibility to insure that all text is already in the appropriate form before a comparison or before getting a CollationKey. Adjusting decomposition mode allows the user to select between faster and more complete collation behavior. Since a great many of the worlds languages do not require text normalization, most locales set no as the default decomposition mode.
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationStrength
member.summary: The strength property determines the minimum level of difference considered significant during comparison. See also: http://icu-project.org/apiref/icu4j/com/ibm/icu/text/Collator.html
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationStrength.Primary
member.summary: Typically, this is used to denote differences between base characters (for example, "a" < "b"). It is the strongest difference. For example, dictionaries are divided into different sections by base character.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationStrength.Secondary
member.summary: Accents in the characters are considered secondary differences (for example, "as" < "s" < "at"). Other differences between letters can also be considered secondary differences, depending on the language. A secondary difference is ignored when there is a primary difference anywhere in the strings.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationStrength.Tertiary
member.summary: Upper and lower case differences in characters are distinguished at tertiary strength (for example, "ao" < "Ao" < "a"). In addition, a variant of a letter differs from the base form on the tertiary strength (such as "A" and ""). Another example is the difference between large and small Kana. A tertiary difference is ignored when there is a primary or secondary difference anywhere in the strings.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationStrength.Quaternary
member.summary: When punctuation is ignored (see Ignoring Punctuations in the User Guide) at PRIMARY to TERTIARY strength, an additional strength level can be used to distinguish words with and without punctuation (for example, "ab" < "a-b" < "aB"). This difference is ignored when there is a PRIMARY, SECONDARY or TERTIARY difference. The QUATERNARY strength should only be used if ignoring punctuation is required.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationStrength.Indentical
member.summary: When all other strengths are equal, the IDENTICAL strength is used as a tiebreaker. The Unicode code point values of the NFD form of each string are compared, just in case there is no difference. For example, Hebrew cantellation marks are only distinguished at this strength. This strength should be used sparingly, as only code point value differences between two strings is an extremely rare occurrence. Using this strength substantially decreases the performance for both comparison and collation key generation APIs. This strength also increases the size of the collation key.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IIcuTokenizer
member.summary: Tokenizes text into words on word boundaries, as defined in UAX #29: Unicode Text Segmentation. It behaves much like the standard tokenizer, but adds better support for some Asian languages by using a dictionary-based approach to identify words in Thai, Lao, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, and using custom rules to break Myanmar and Khmer text into syllables.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilter
member.summary: The kuromoji_part_of_speech token filter removes tokens that match a set of part-of-speech tags. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilter.StopTags
member.summary: An array of part-of-speech tags that should be removed. It defaults to the stoptags.txt file embedded in the lucene-analyzer-kuromoji.jar.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiReadingFormTokenFilter
member.summary: The kuromoji_readingform token filter replaces the token with its reading form in either katakana or romaji. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiReadingFormTokenFilter.UseRomaji
member.summary: Whether romaji reading form should be output instead of katakana. Defaults to false.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiStemmerTokenFilter
member.summary: The kuromoji_stemmer token filter normalizes common katakana spelling variations ending in a long sound character by removing this character (U+30FC). Only full-width katakana characters are supported. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiStemmerTokenFilter.MinimumLength
member.summary: Katakana words shorter than the minimum length are not stemmed (default is 4).

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiTokenizationMode
member.summary: The tokenization mode determines how the tokenizer handles compound and unknown words. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiTokenizationMode.Normal
member.summary: Normal segmentation, no decomposition for compounds

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiTokenizationMode.Search
member.summary: Segmentation geared towards search. This includes a decompounding process for long nouns, also including the full compound token as a synonym.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiTokenizationMode.Extended
member.summary: Extended mode outputs unigrams for unknown words.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer.DiscardPunctuation
member.summary: Whether punctuation should be discarded from the output. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer.DiscardCompoundToken
member.summary: Whether original compound tokens should be discarded from the output with . Defaults to `false`.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer.Mode
member.summary: The tokenization mode determines how the tokenizer handles compound and unknown words.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer.NBestCost
member.summary: The nbest_cost parameter specifies an additional Viterbi cost. The KuromojiTokenizer will include all tokens in Viterbi paths that are within the nbest_cost value of the best path.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer.NBestExamples
member.summary: The nbest_examples can be used to find a nbest_cost value based on examples. For example, a value of /-/-/ indicates that in the texts, (Mt. Hakone) and (Narita Airport) wed like a cost that gives is us (Hakone) and (Narita).

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer.UserDictionary
member.summary: The Kuromoji tokenizer uses the MeCab-IPADIC dictionary by default. A user_dictionary may be appended to the default dictionary.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer.UserDictionaryRules
member.summary: Inline rule version of

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IPhoneticTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter that converts tokens to their phonetic representation using Soundex, Metaphone, and a variety of other algorithms.
member.remarks: Requires the Phonetic Analysis plugin be installed (analysis-phonetic)

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IPhoneticTokenFilter.Encoder
member.summary: The type of phonetic encoding to use

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IPhoneticTokenFilter.LanguageSet
member.summary: An array of languages to check. If not specified, then the language will be guessed
member.remarks: Valid for only

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IPhoneticTokenFilter.MaxCodeLength
member.summary: The maximum length of the emitted metaphone token. Defaults to 4
member.remarks: Valid for only

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IPhoneticTokenFilter.NameType
member.summary: Whether names are ashkenazi, sephardic, or generic. Defaults to generic
member.remarks: Valid for only

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IPhoneticTokenFilter.Replace
member.summary: The replace parameter (defaults to true) controls if the token processed should be replaced with the encoded one (set it to true), or added (set it to false).

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IPhoneticTokenFilter.RuleType
member.summary: Whether matching should be exact or approximate. Defaults to approximate
member.remarks: Valid for only

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IAsciiFoldingTokenFilter
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the Basic Latin Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.summary:
Token filter that generates bigrams for frequently occuring terms. Single terms are still indexed.
Note, common_words or common_words_path field is required.

member.summary: If true, common words matching will be case insensitive.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ICommonGramsTokenFilter.QueryMode
member.summary: Generates bigrams then removes common words and single terms followed by a common word.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IConditionTokenFilter
member.summary: The conditional token filter takes a predicate script and a list of subfilters, and only applies the subfilters to the current token if it matches the predicate.

member.summary: a predicate script that determines whether or not the filters will be applied to the current token. Note that only inline scripts are supported

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IConditionTokenFilter.Filters
member.summary: a chain of token filters to apply to the current token if the predicate matches. These can be any token filters defined elsewhere in the index mappings.

member.summary: Character used for splitting the tokens.

member.summary: Accepts articles setting which is a set of stop words articles

member.summary: Whether articles should be handled case-insensitively. Defaults to false.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IFingerprintTokenFilter
member.summary: The fingerprint token filter emits a single token which is useful for fingerprinting a body of text, and/or providing a token that can be clustered on. It does this by sorting the tokens, deduplicating and then concatenating them back into a single token.

member.summary: The maximum token size to emit. Defaults to 255.

member.summary: The character that separates the tokens after concatenation. Defaults to a space.

member.summary: The maximum token size to emit. Defaults to 255.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.FingerprintTokenFilter.Separator
member.summary: The character that separates the tokens after concatenation. Defaults to a space.

Basic support for hunspell stemming.

member.summary:
The kstem token filter is a high performance filter for english.
All terms must already be lowercased (use lowercase filter) for this filter to work correctly.

member.summary: If set to true the filter exhaust the stream even if max_token_count tokens have been consumed already.

member.summary: The maximum number of tokens that should be indexed per document and field.

member.summary: The regular expression patterns to capture

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IShingleTokenFilter
member.summary:
A token filter of type shingle that constructs shingles (token n-grams) from a token stream.
In other words, it creates combinations of tokens as a single token.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IShingleTokenFilter.FillerToken
member.summary: The string to use as a replacement for each position at which there is no actual token in the stream. For instance this string is used if the position increment is greater than one when a stop filter is used together with the shingle filter. Defaults to "_"

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IShingleTokenFilter.MaxShingleSize
member.summary: The maximum shingle size. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IShingleTokenFilter.MinShingleSize
member.summary: The minimum shingle size. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IShingleTokenFilter.OutputUnigrams
member.summary: If true the output will contain the input tokens (unigrams) as well as the shingles. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IShingleTokenFilter.OutputUnigramsIfNoShingles
member.summary:
If output_unigrams is false the output will contain the input tokens (unigrams) if no shingles are available.
Note if output_unigrams is set to true this setting has no effect. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IShingleTokenFilter.TokenSeparator
member.summary: The string to use when joining adjacent tokens to form a shingle. Defaults to " ".

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.ISnowballTokenFilter
member.summary: A filter that stems words using a Snowball-generated stemmer.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IStemmerOverrideTokenFilter
member.summary: Overrides stemming algorithms, by applying a custom mapping, then protecting these terms from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IStemmerOverrideTokenFilter.Rules
member.summary: A list of mapping rules to use.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IStemmerOverrideTokenFilter.RulesPath
member.summary: A path (either relative to config location, or absolute) to a list of mappings.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IStemmerTokenFilter
member.summary: A filter that stems words (similar to snowball, but with more options).

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IStopTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type stop that removes stop words from token streams.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IStopTokenFilter.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Set to true to lower case all words first. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IStopTokenFilter.RemoveTrailing
member.summary: Set to false in order to not ignore the last term of a search if it is a stop word. This is very useful for the completion suggester as a query like green a can be extended to green apple even though you remove stop words in general. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IStopTokenFilter.StopWords
member.summary: A list of stop words to use. Defaults to `_english_` stop words.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IStopTokenFilter.StopWordsPath
member.summary: A path (either relative to config location, or absolute) to a stopwords file configuration. Each stop word should be in its own "line" (separated by a line break). The file must be UTF-8 encoded.

member.summary: Whether this token filter can reload changes to synonym files on demand. Marking as updateable means this component is only usable at search time

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.TokenFiltersDescriptor.Fingerprint(System.String,System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.FingerprintTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IFingerprintTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type fingerprint The fingerprint token filter that emits a single token which is useful for fingerprinting a body of text, and/or providing a token that can be clustered on. It does this by sorting the tokens, deduplicating and then concatenating them back into a single token.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.TokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiReadingForm(System.String,System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiReadingFormTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiReadingFormTokenFilter})

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter
member.summary: Named word_delimiter, it Splits words into subwords and performs optional transformations on subword groups.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.CatenateAll
member.summary: If true causes all subword parts to be catenated: "wi-fi-4000" "wifi4000". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.CatenateNumbers
member.summary: If true causes maximum runs of number parts to be catenated: "500-42" "50042". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.CatenateWords
member.summary: If true causes maximum runs of word parts to be catenated: "wi-fi" "wifi". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.GenerateNumberParts
member.summary: If true causes number subwords to be generated: "500-42" "500" "42". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.GenerateWordParts
member.summary: If true causes parts of words to be generated: "PowerShot" "Power" "Shot". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.PreserveOriginal
member.summary: If true includes original words in subwords: "500-42" "500-42" "500" "42". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.ProtectedWords
member.summary: A list of protected words from being delimiter.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.ProtectedWordsPath
member.summary: protected_words_path which resolved to a file configured with protected words (one on each line). Automatically resolves to config/ based location if exists.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.SplitOnCaseChange
member.summary: If true causes "PowerShot" to be two tokens; ("Power-Shot" remains two parts regards). Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.SplitOnNumerics
member.summary: If true causes "j2se" to be three tokens; "j" "2" "se". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.StemEnglishPossessive
member.summary: If true causes trailing "'s" to be removed for each subword: "ONeils" "O", "Neil". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.TypeTable
member.summary: A custom type mapping table

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter.TypeTablePath
member.summary: A path to a custom type mapping table file

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter
member.summary: Named word_delimiter, it Splits words into subwords and performs optional transformations on subword groups. Unlike the word_delimiter this token filter named word_delimiter_graph correctly handles multi terms expansion at query time.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.AdjustOffsets
member.summary: By default, the filter tries to output subtokens with adjusted offsets to reflect their actual position in the token stream. However, when used in combination with other filters that alter the length or starting position of tokens without changing their offsets (e.g. ) this can cause tokens with illegal offsets to be emitted. Setting to false will stop from adjusting these internal offsets.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.CatenateAll
member.summary: If true causes all subword parts to be catenated: "wi-fi-4000" "wifi4000". Defaults to false.

member.summary: If true causes maximum runs of number parts to be catenated: "500-42" "50042". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.CatenateWords
member.summary: If true causes maximum runs of word parts to be catenated: "wi-fi" "wifi". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.GenerateNumberParts
member.summary: If true causes number subwords to be generated: "500-42" "500" "42". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.GenerateWordParts
member.summary: If true causes parts of words to be generated: "PowerShot" "Power" "Shot". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.IgnoreKeywords
member.summary: If true, the filter skips tokens with a keyword attribute of true. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.PreserveOriginal
member.summary: If true includes original words in subwords: "500-42" "500-42" "500" "42". Defaults to false.

member.summary: A list of protected words from being delimiter.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.ICharGroupTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer that breaks text into terms whenever it encounters a character which is in a defined set. It is mostly useful for cases where a simple custom tokenization is desired, and the overhead of use of is not acceptable.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ICharGroupTokenizer.TokenizeOnCharacters
member.summary: A list containing a list of characters to tokenize the string on. Whenever a character from this list is encountered, a new token is started. This accepts either single characters like eg. -, or character groups: whitespace, letter, digit, punctuation, symbol.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ICharGroupTokenizer.MaxTokenLength
member.summary: The maximum token length. If a token is seen that exceeds this length then it is split at intervals. Defaults to `255`.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IKeywordTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type keyword that emits the entire input as a single input.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IKeywordTokenizer.BufferSize
member.summary: The term buffer size. Defaults to 256.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.ILetterTokenizer
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type letter that divides text at non-letters. Thats to say, it defines tokens as maximal strings of adjacent letters.
Note, this does a decent job for most European languages, but does a terrible job for some Asian languages, where words are not separated by spaces.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.ILowercaseTokenizer
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type lowercase that performs the function of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter together.
It divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case.
While it is functionally equivalent to the combination of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter,
there is a performance advantage to doing the two tasks at once, hence this (redundant) implementation.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IEdgeNGramTokenizer

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IEdgeNGramTokenizer.TokenChars

Custom characters that should be treated as part of a token. For example, setting this to +-_ will make the tokenizer treat the plus, minus and underscore sign as part of a token.
Requires setting as part of

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.INoriTokenizer.UserDictionary
member.summary: The Nori tokenizer uses the mecab-ko-dic dictionary by default. A user_dictionary with custom nouns (NNG) may be appended to the default dictionary. This property allows you to specify this file on disk

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.INoriTokenizer.UserDictionaryRules
member.summary: The Nori tokenizer uses the mecab-ko-dic dictionary by default. A user_dictionary with custom nouns (NNG) can be specified inline with this property

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IPathHierarchyTokenizer
member.summary:
The path_hierarchy tokenizer takes something like this:
/something/something/else
And produces tokens:
/something
/something/something
/something/something/else

member.summary: The buffer size to use, defaults to 1024.

member.summary: The character delimiter to use, defaults to /.

member.summary: An optional replacement character to use. Defaults to the delimiter

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IPathHierarchyTokenizer.Reverse
member.summary: Generates tokens in reverse order, defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IPathHierarchyTokenizer.Skip
member.summary: Controls initial tokens to skip, defaults to 0.

The tokenizer implements the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm, as specified in Unicode Standard Annex #29.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.TokenizersDescriptor.Icu(System.String,System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.IcuTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IIcuTokenizer})
member.summary: Tokenizes text into words on word boundaries, as defined in UAX #29: Unicode Text Segmentation. It behaves much like the standard tokenizer, but adds better support for some Asian languages by using a dictionary-based approach to identify words in Thai, Lao, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, and using custom rules to break Myanmar and Khmer text into syllables. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin:

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IResponse.IsValid
member.summary:
Checks if a response is functionally valid or not. This is a OpenSearch.Client abstraction to have a single property to check whether there was something wrong with a request.
For instance, an OpenSearch bulk response always returns 200 and individual bulk items may fail, will be false in that case.
You can also configure the client to always throw an using if the response is not valid

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IResponse.OriginalException
member.summary:
If the request resulted in an exception on the client side this will hold the exception that was thrown.
This property is a shortcut to 's and is possibly set when is false depending on the cause of the error
You can also configure the client to always throw an using if the response is not valid

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IResponse.ServerError
member.summary:
If the response results in an error on OpenSearch's side an error element will be returned, this is mapped to in OpenSearch.Client.

You can also configure the client to always throw an using if the response is not valid

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.PutMappingDescriptor`1.AutoMap(OpenSearch.Client.IPropertyVisitor,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Convenience method to map as much as it can based on OpenSearchType attributes set on the type.
This method also automatically sets up mappings for primitive values types (e.g. int, long, double, DateTime...)
Class types default to object and Enums to int
Later calls can override whatever is set by this call.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.SearchTemplateDescriptor`1.Routing(OpenSearch.Client.Routing)
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
OpenSearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document OSC will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.BulkOperationsCollection`1
member.summary: This class is used by which needs thread safe adding as well as expose an equivalent of . Because operations from OpenSearch are executed in order none of the types in System.Collection.Concurrent can't be used for this. We need to preserve insert order and exposed indexed index because is ordered and lines up with allowing one to zip the two together.

member.summary: If `true` then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` (the default) then do nothing with refreshes.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.BulkRequest.RequireAlias
member.summary: Sets require_alias for all incoming documents. Defaults to unset (false)

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.BulkRequest.Routing
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
OpenSearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document OSC will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.summary: If a bulk operation fails because it receives documents it can not retry they will be fed to this callback. If is set to true processing will continue, so this callback can be used to feed into a dead letter queue. Otherwise bulk all indexing will be halted.

BulkAll is a generic helper that will partition any lazy stream of documents and send them to OpenSearch as concurrent bulk requests.

member.summary:
Whether to include field statistics. When set to false,
- document count (how many documents contain this field)
- sum of document frequencies (the sum of document frequencies for all terms in this field)
- sum of total term frequencies (the sum of total term frequencies of each term in this field)
will be omitted. Default is true.

member.summary: Whether to include the start and end offsets. Default is true.

member.summary: Whether to include the term payloads as base64 encoded bytes. Default is true

member.summary: Whether to include the term positions. Default is true

member.summary: The document field to generate term vectors for

member.summary:
Whether to include term statistics. When set to true,
- total term frequency (how often a term occurs in all documents)
- document frequency (the number of documents containing the current term)
will be returned. Default is false since term statistics can have a large performance impact.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.ReindexObservable`2.CreateIndexIfNeeded(OpenSearch.Client.Indices,System.String)
member.summary: Tries to create the target index if it does not exist already, if the source points to a single index we'll use the original index settings to bootstrap the create index request if not provided
member.returns: Either the number of shards from to source or the target as a slice hint to ScrollAll

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IReindexRequest`2
member.summary:
A reindex implementation that uses ScrollAll() BulkAll() to compose a reindex pipeline.
This differs from ReindexOnServer() in that documents are fetched from OpenSearch, transformed on the client side, then sent back to OpenSearch.
This will create the target index if it doesn't exist already. If is not specified and the source of the reindex points to a single index we try and reuse the settings from source. You can completely opt out of all of this using

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IReindexRequest`2.BackPressureFactor
member.summary:
The scroll typically outperforms the bulk operations by a long shot. If we'd leave things unbounded you'd quickly have way too many pending scroll requests. What this property allows you to express is that for each bucket in the max concurrency of the minimum max concurrency between producer and consumer amply the maximum overal pending of the other side by this factor. Typically the concurrency of the consumer (bulkall) will be lower and with this factor we can dampen the overall pending scroll requests while we are still processing bulk requests.
defaults to 4 if not provided

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IReindexRequest`2.BulkAll
member.summary:
Provide a factory for the bulk all request, the first argument is the lazy collection of scroll results which is a mandatory argument to create or
Note that is always overriden as well as

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IReindexRequest`2.CreateIndexRequest
member.summary: Describe how the newly created index should be created. Remember you can also register Index Templates for more dynamic usecases.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IReindexRequest`2.OmitIndexCreation
member.summary: Do not send a create index call on the target index, assume the index has been created outside of the reindex. Reindex will never create the index if it already exists however this will also omit the IndexExists call.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IReindexRequest`2.ScrollAll
member.summary:
Describes the scroll operation where we need to fetch the documents from.
Note that can be overriden by our own.

member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
OpenSearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document OSC will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IHelperCallable
member.summary: May be applied to helper requests where they may be called by an upstream helper.
member.remarks: For example, the reindex helper calls down into the bulk helper and scroll helpers. and therefore both implement this interface.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IHelperCallable.ParentMetaData
member.summary: The of the parent helper when this requestis created by a parent helper.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergePolicySettings.ExpungeDeletesAllowed
member.summary: When expungeDeletes is called, we only merge away a segment if its delete percentage is over this threshold. Default is 10.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergePolicySettings.FloorSegment
member.summary: Segments smaller than this are "rounded up" to this size, i.e. treated as equal (floor) size for merge selection. This is to prevent frequent flushing of tiny segments, thus preventing a long tail in the index. Default is 2mb.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergePolicySettings.MaxMergeAtOnce
member.summary: Maximum number of segments to be merged at a time during "normal" merging. Default is 10.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergePolicySettings.MaxMergeAtOnceExplicit
member.summary: Maximum number of segments to be merged at a time, during optimize or expungeDeletes. Default is 30.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergePolicySettings.MaxMergedSegment
member.summary: Maximum sized segment to produce during normal merging (not explicit optimize). This setting is approximate: the estimate of the merged segment size is made by summing sizes of to-be-merged segments (compensating for percent deleted docs). Default is 5gb.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergePolicySettings.ReclaimDeletesWeight
member.summary: Controls how aggressively merges that reclaim more deletions are favored. Higher values favor selecting merges that reclaim deletions. A value of 0.0 means deletions dont impact merge selection. Defaults to 2.0

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergePolicySettings.SegmentsPerTier
member.summary: Sets the allowed number of segments per tier. Smaller values mean more merging but fewer segments. Default is 10. Note, this value needs to be >= than the max_merge_at_once otherwise youll force too many merges to occur.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergeSchedulerSettings.AutoThrottle
member.summary: If this is true (the default), then the merge scheduler will rate-limit IO (writes) for merges to an adaptive value depending on how many merges are requested over time. An application with a low indexing rate that unluckily suddenly requires a large merge will see that merge aggressively throttled, while an application doing heavy indexing will see the throttle move higher to allow merges to keep up with ongoing indexing.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IMergeSchedulerSettings.MaxThreadCount
member.summary: The maximum number of threads that may be merging at once. Defaults to Math.max(1, Math.min(4, Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors() / 2)) which works well for a good solid-state-disk (SSD). If your index is on spinning platter drives instead, decrease this to 1.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.BlocksMetadata

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.BlocksRead
member.summary: Set to true to disable read operations against the index.

member.summary: Set to true to make the index and index metadata read only, false to allow writes and metadata changes.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.BlocksWrite
member.summary: Set to true to disable write operations against the index.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.BlocksReadOnlyAllowDelete
member.summary: Set to true to disable read operations, but allow delete operations, against the index.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.Merge

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.NumberOfReplicas
member.summary: The number of replicas each primary shard has. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.Priority
member.summary: Unallocated shards are recovered in order of priority when set

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.RecoveryInitialShards
member.summary: A primary shard is only recovered only if there are enough nodes available to allocate sufficient replicas to form a quorum.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.RefreshInterval
member.summary: How often to perform a refresh operation, which makes recent changes to the index visible to search. Defaults to 1s. Can be set to -1 to disable refresh.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.RequestsCacheEnabled
member.summary: Enables the shard-level request cache. Not enabled by default.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.RoutingAllocationTotalShardsPerNode

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.SlowLog

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.Translog
member.summary: Configure translog settings. This should only be used by experts who know what they're doing

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.UnassignedNodeLeftDelayedTimeout
member.summary: The allocation of replica shards which become unassigned because a node has left can be delayed with this dynamic setting, which defaults to 1m.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.DefaultPipeline
member.summary: The default ingest node pipeline for this index. Index requests will fail if the default pipeline is set and the pipeline does not exist. The default may be overridden using the pipeline parameter. The special pipeline name _none indicates no ingest pipeline should be run.`

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDynamicIndexSettings.FinalPipeline
member.summary: The final ingest pipeline for this index. Index requests will fail if the final pipeline is set and the pipeline does not exist. The final pipeline always runs after the request pipeline (if specified) and the default pipeline (if it exists). The special pipeline name `_none` indicates no ingest pipeline will run.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISortingSettings.Missing

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISortingSettings.Mode

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.FileSystemStorageImplementation
member.summary: The store module allows you to control how index data is stored and accessed on disk.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.FileSystemStorageImplementation.Simple
member.summary: The Simple FS type is a straightforward implementation of file system storage (maps to Lucene SimpleFsDirectory) using a random access file. This implementation has poor concurrent performance (multiple threads will bottleneck). It is usually better to use the niofs when you need index persistence.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.FileSystemStorageImplementation.NIO
member.summary: The NIO FS type stores the shard index on the file system (maps to Lucene NIOFSDirectory) using NIO. It allows multiple threads to read from the same file concurrently. It is not recommended on Windows because of a bug in the SUN Java implementation.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.FileSystemStorageImplementation.MMap
member.summary: The MMap FS type stores the shard index on the file system (maps to Lucene MMapDirectory) by mapping a file into memory (mmap). Memory mapping uses up a portion of the virtual memory address space in your process equal to the size of the file being mapped. Before using this class, be sure you have allowed plenty of virtual address space.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.FileSystemStorageImplementation.Default
member.summary: The default type is a hybrid of NIO FS and MMapFS, which chooses the best file system for each type of file. Currently only the Lucene term dictionary and doc values files are memory mapped to reduce the impact on the operating system. All other files are opened using Lucene NIOFSDirectory.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ITranslogFlushSettings.Interval
member.summary: How often to check if a flush is needed, randomized between the interval value and 2x the interval value. Defaults to 5s.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ITranslogFlushSettings.ThresholdPeriod
member.summary: How long to wait before triggering a flush regardless of translog size. Defaults to 30m.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ITranslogFlushSettings.ThresholdSize
member.summary: Once the translog hits this size, a flush will happen. Defaults to 512mb.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ITranslogSettings.Durability
member.summary: Whether or not to fsync and commit the translog after every index, delete, update, or bulk request

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ITranslogSettings.Flush
member.summary: Dynamically updatable flush settings

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ITranslogSettings.SyncInterval
member.summary: How often the translog is fsynced to disk and committed, regardless of write operations. Defaults to 5s.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IBM25Similarity
member.summary: BM25 Similarity. Introduced in Stephen E. Robertson, Steve Walker, Susan Jones, Micheline Hancock-Beaulieu, and Mike Gatford. Okapi at TREC-3. In Proceedings of the Third Text Retrieval Conference (TREC 1994). Gaithersburg, USA, November 1994.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IBM25Similarity.B
member.summary: Controls to what degree document length normalizes tf values.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IBM25Similarity.DiscountOverlaps
member.summary: Sets whether overlap tokens (Tokens with 0 position increment) are ignored when computing norm.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IBM25Similarity.K1
member.summary: Controls non-linear term frequency normalization (saturation).

member.summary: A custom similarity

member.summary: independence measure

member.summary: Similarity that implements the divergence from independence model

member.summary: The independence measure

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRAfterEffect.No
member.summary: Implementation used when there is no aftereffect.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRAfterEffect.B
member.summary: Model of the information gain based on the ratio of two Bernoulli processes.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRAfterEffect.L
member.summary: Model of the information gain based on Laplace's law of succession.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRBasicModel.BE
member.summary: Limiting form of the Bose-Einstein model. The formula used in Lucene differs slightly from the one in the original paper: F is increased by tfn+1 and N is increased by F

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRBasicModel.D
member.summary: Implements the approximation of the binomial model with the divergence for DFR. The formula used in Lucene differs slightly from the one in the original paper: to avoid underflow for small values of N and F, N is increased by 1 and F is always increased by tfn+1.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRBasicModel.G
member.summary: Geometric as limiting form of the Bose-Einstein model. The formula used in Lucene differs slightly from the one in the original paper: F is increased by 1 and N is increased by F.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRBasicModel.IF
member.summary: An approximation of the I(ne) model.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRBasicModel.IN
member.summary: The basic tf-idf model of randomness.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRBasicModel.INE
member.summary: Tf-idf model of randomness, based on a mixture of Poisson and inverse document frequency.

member.name: F:OpenSearch.Client.DFRBasicModel.P
member.summary: Implements the Poisson approximation for the binomial model for DFR.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IDFRSimilarity
member.summary: Implements the divergence from randomness (DFR) framework introduced in Gianni Amati and Cornelis Joost Van Rijsbergen. 2002. Probabilistic models of information retrieval based on measuring the divergence from randomness. ACM Trans. Inf. Syst. 20, 4 (October 2002), 357-389. The DFR scoring formula is composed of three separate components: the basic model, the aftereffect and an additional normalization component, represented by the classes BasicModel, AfterEffect and Normalization, respectively.The names of these classes were chosen to match the names of their counterparts in the Terrier IR engine.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IAlias.Filter
member.summary: Provides an easy way to create different "views" of the same index. A filter can be defined using Query DSL and is applied to all Search, Count, Delete By Query and More Like This operations with this alias.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IAlias.IndexRouting
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for index operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IAlias.IsWriteIndex
member.summary: If an alias points to multiple indices, OpenSearch will reject the write operations unless one is explicitly marked as the write alias using this property.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IAlias.IsHidden
member.summary: If true, the alias will be excluded from wildcard expressions by default, unless overriden in the request using the expand_wildcards parameter, similar to hidden indices. This property must be set to the same value on all indices that share an alias. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IAlias.Routing
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for both index and search operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IAlias.SearchRouting
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for search operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.CommonGrams(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.CommonGramsTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ICommonGramsTokenFilter})
member.summary:
Token filter that generates bigrams for frequently occuring terms. Single terms are still indexed.
Note, common_words or common_words_path field is required.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.DelimitedPayload(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.DelimitedPayloadTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IDelimitedPayloadTokenFilter})
member.summary: Splits tokens into tokens and payload whenever a delimiter character is found.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Elision(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.ElisionTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IElisionTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter which removes elisions. For example, lavion (the plane) will tokenized as avion (plane).

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Hunspell(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.HunspellTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IHunspellTokenFilter})
member.summary:
Basic support for hunspell stemming.
Hunspell dictionaries will be picked up from a dedicated hunspell directory on the filesystem.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeepTypes(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KeepTypesTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKeepTypesTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type keep that only keeps tokens with text contained in a predefined set of words.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeepWords(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KeepWordsTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKeepWordsTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type keep that only keeps tokens with text contained in a predefined set of words.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeywordMarker(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KeywordMarkerTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKeywordMarkerTokenFilter})
member.summary: Protects words from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KStem(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KStemTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKStemTokenFilter})
member.summary:
The kstem token filter is a high performance filter for english.
All terms must already be lowercased (use lowercase filter) for this filter to work correctly.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Length(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.LengthTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ILengthTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type length that removes words that are too long or too short for the stream.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.LimitTokenCount(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.LimitTokenCountTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ILimitTokenCountTokenFilter})
member.summary: Limits the number of tokens that are indexed per document and field.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Lowercase(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.LowercaseTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ILowercaseTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type lowercase that normalizes token text to lower case.
Lowercase token filter supports Greek and Turkish lowercase token filters through the language parameter.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.NGram(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.NGramTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.INGramTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type nGram.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PatternCapture(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.PatternCaptureTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IPatternCaptureTokenFilter})
member.summary: The pattern_capture token filter, unlike the pattern tokenizer, emits a token for every capture group in the regular expression.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PatternReplace(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.PatternReplaceTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IPatternReplaceTokenFilter})
member.summary: The pattern_replace token filter allows to easily handle string replacements based on a regular expression.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PorterStem(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.PorterStemTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IPorterStemTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type porterStem that transforms the token stream as per the Porter stemming algorithm.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Reverse(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.ReverseTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IReverseTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type reverse that simply reverses the tokens.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Snowball(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.SnowballTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ISnowballTokenFilter})
member.summary: A filter that stems words using a Snowball-generated stemmer.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Stemmer(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.StemmerTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IStemmerTokenFilter})
member.summary: A filter that stems words (similar to snowball, but with more options).

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.StemmerOverride(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.StemmerOverrideTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IStemmerOverrideTokenFilter})
member.summary: Overrides stemming algorithms, by applying a custom mapping, then protecting these terms from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Trim(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.TrimTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ITrimTokenFilter})
member.summary: The trim token filter trims surrounding whitespaces around a token.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Truncate(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.TruncateTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ITruncateTokenFilter})
member.summary:
The truncate token filter can be used to truncate tokens into a specific length. This can come in handy with keyword (single token)
based mapped fields that are used for sorting in order to reduce memory usage.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Unique(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.UniqueTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IUniqueTokenFilter})
member.summary: The unique token filter can be used to only index unique tokens during analysis. By default it is applied on all the token stream

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Uppercase(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.UppercaseTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IUppercaseTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type uppercase that normalizes token text to upper case.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Fingerprint(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.FingerprintTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IFingerprintTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type fingerprint The fingerprint token filter that emits a single token which is useful for fingerprinting a body of text, and/or providing a token that can be clustered on. It does this by sorting the tokens, deduplicating and then concatenating them back into a single token.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiStemmer(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiStemmerTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiStemmerTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_stemmer token filter normalizes common katakana spelling variations ending in a long sound character by removing this character (U+30FC). Only full-width katakana characters are supported. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiReadingForm(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiReadingFormTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiReadingFormTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_readingform token filter replaces the token with its reading form in either katakana or romaji. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiPartOfSpeech(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_part_of_speech token filter removes tokens that match a set of part-of-speech tags. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuCollation(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.IcuCollationTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IIcuCollationTokenFilter})
member.summary: Collations are used for sorting documents in a language-specific word order. The icu_collation token filter is available to all indices and defaults to using the DUCET collation, which is a best-effort attempt at language-neutral sorting. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin:

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuFolding(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.IcuFoldingTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IIcuFoldingTokenFilter})
member.summary: Case folding of Unicode characters based on UTR#30, like the ASCII-folding token filter on steroids. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin:

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuNormalization(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.IcuNormalizationTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IIcuNormalizationTokenFilter})
member.summary: Normalizes as defined here: http://userguide.icu-project.org/transforms/normalization Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin:

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuTransform(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.IcuTransformTokenFilterDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IIcuTransformTokenFilter})
member.summary: Transforms are used to process Unicode text in many different ways, such as case mapping, normalization, transliteration and bidirectional text handling. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin:

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.EdgeNGram(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.EdgeNGramTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IEdgeNGramTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type edgeNGram.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.NGram(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.NGramTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.INGramTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type nGram.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Keyword(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KeywordTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKeywordTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type keyword that emits the entire input as a single input.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Letter(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.LetterTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ILetterTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type letter that divides text at non-letters. Thats to say, it defines tokens as maximal strings of adjacent letters.
Note, this does a decent job for most European languages, but does a terrible job for some Asian languages, where words are not separated by spaces.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Lowercase(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.LowercaseTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.ILowercaseTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type lowercase that performs the function of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter together.
It divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case.
While it is functionally equivalent to the combination of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter,
there is a performance advantage to doing the two tasks at once, hence this (redundant) implementation.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.PathHierarchy(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.PathHierarchyTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IPathHierarchyTokenizer})
member.summary:
The path_hierarchy tokenizer takes something like this:
/something/something/else
And produces tokens:
/something
/something/something
/something/something/else

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Pattern(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.PatternTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IPatternTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Standard(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.StandardTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IStandardTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type standard providing grammar based tokenizer that is a good tokenizer for most European language documents.
The tokenizer implements the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm, as specified in Unicode Standard Annex #29.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.UaxEmailUrl(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.UaxEmailUrlTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IUaxEmailUrlTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type uax_url_email which works exactly like the standard tokenizer, but tokenizes emails and urls as single tokens

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Whitespace(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.WhitespaceTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IWhitespaceTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type whitespace that divides text at whitespace.

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Kuromoji(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.KuromojiTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IKuromojiTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin:

member.name: M:OpenSearch.Client.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Icu(System.Func{OpenSearch.Client.IcuTokenizerDescriptor,OpenSearch.Client.IIcuTokenizer})
member.summary: Tokenizes text into words on word boundaries, as defined in UAX #29: Unicode Text Segmentation. It behaves much like the standard tokenizer, but adds better support for some Asian languages by using a dictionary-based approach to identify words in Thai, Lao, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, and using custom rules to break Myanmar and Khmer text into syllables. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin:

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IBytesProcessor
member.summary: Converts a human readable byte value (e.g. 1kb) to its value in bytes (e.g. 1024). Supported human readable units are "b", "kb", "mb", "gb", "tb", "pb" case insensitive. An error will occur if the field is not a supported format or resultant value exceeds 2^63.

member.summary: The field to convert bytes from

member.summary: If true and does not exist or is null, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document. Default is false

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IBytesProcessor.TargetField
member.summary: The field to assign the converted value to, by default is updated in-place

member.summary: The type to convert the existing value to

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IDissectProcessor
member.summary: Similar to the Grok Processor, dissect also extracts structured fields out of a single text field within a document. However unlike the Grok Processor, dissect does not use Regular Expressions. This allows dissects syntax to be simple and, for some cases faster, than the Grok Processor.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDissectProcessor.Pattern

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IDissectProcessor.AppendSeparator
member.summary: The character(s) that separate the appended fields.

member.summary: Expands a field with dots into an object field. This processor allows fields with dots in the name to be accessible by other processors in the pipeline. Otherwise these fields cant be accessed by any processor.

member.summary: The field that contains the field to expand. Only required if the field to expand is part another object field, because the field option can only understand leaf fields.

member.summary: The field to expand into an object field

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.DotExpanderProcessor.Path

member.summary: Drops the document without raising any errors. This is useful to prevent the document from getting indexed based on some condition.

member.summary: Raises an exception. This is useful for when you expect a pipeline to fail and want to relay a specific message to the requester.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IFailProcessor.Message
member.summary: The error message thrown by the processor. Supports template snippets.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IForeachProcessor
member.summary: Processes elements in an array of unknown length. All processors can operate on elements inside an array, but if all elements of an array need to be processed in the same way, defining a processor for each element becomes cumbersome and tricky because it is likely that the number of elements in an array is unknown. For this reason the foreach processor exists. By specifying the field holding array elements and a processor that defines what should happen to each element, array fields can easily be preprocessed.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IForeachProcessor.Field
member.summary: The array field

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IForeachProcessor.Processor
member.summary: The processor to execute against each field

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IForeachProcessor.IgnoreMissing
member.summary: If true and does not exist or is null, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document. Default is false

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGrokProcessor.Field
member.summary: The field to use for grok expression parsing

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGrokProcessor.PatternDefinitions
member.summary: A map of pattern-name and pattern tuples defining custom patterns to be used by the current processor. Patterns matching existing names will override the pre-existing definition.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGrokProcessor.Patterns
member.summary: An ordered list of grok expression to match and extract named captures with. Returns on the first expression in the list that matches.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGrokProcessor.TraceMatch
member.summary: when true, _ingest._grok_match_index will be inserted into your matched documents metadata with the index into the pattern found in patterns that matched.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IGrokProcessor.IgnoreMissing
member.summary: If true and does not exist or is null, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document. Default is false

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ITypeMapping.DynamicTemplates
member.summary:
Dynamic templates allow you to define custom mappings that can be applied to dynamically added fields based on
- the datatype detected by OpenSearch, with .
- the name of the field, with and or .
- the full dotted path to the field, with and .
The original field name {name} and the detected datatype {dynamic_type} template variables can be used in the mapping specification as placeholders.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ITypeMapping.FieldNamesField
member.summary: Used to index the names of every field in a document that contains any value other than null. This field was used by the exists query to find documents that either have or dont have any non-null value for a particular field. Now, it only indexes the names of fields that have doc_values and norms disabled. Can be disabled. Disabling _field_names is often not necessary because it no longer carries the index overhead it once did. If you have a lot of fields which have doc_values and norms disabled and you do not need to execute exists queries using those fields you might want to disable

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IRankFeatureProperty
member.summary: A field that can index numbers so that they can later be used to boost documents in queries with a rank_feature query.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IRankFeatureProperty.PositiveScoreImpact
member.summary: Rank features that correlate negatively with the score should set to false (defaults to true). This will be used by the rank_feature query to modify the scoring formula in such a way that the score decreases with the value of the feature instead of increasing. For instance in web search, the url length is a commonly used feature which correlates negatively with scores.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.IRankFeaturesProperty
member.summary: A field that can index numeric feature vectors, so that they can later be used to boost documents in queries with a rank_feature query. It is analogous to the datatype, but is better suited when the list of features is sparse so that it wouldn't be reasonable to add one field to the mappings for each of them.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty
member.summary:
A text-like field that is optimized to provide out-of-the-box support for the "search as you type" completion use case.
It creates a series of subfields that are analyzed to index terms that can be efficiently matched by a query that partially matches the entire indexed text value. Both prefix completion (i.e matching terms starting at the beginning of the input) and infix completion (i.e. matching terms at any position within the input) are supported.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.Analyzer
member.summary: The analyzer which should be used for analyzed string fields, both at index-time and at search-time (unless overridden by the search_analyzer). Defaults to the default index analyzer, or the standard analyzer.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.Index
member.summary: Should the field be searchable? Accepts true (default) or false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.IndexOptions
member.summary: What information should be stored in the index, for search and highlighting purposes. Defaults to .

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.MaxShingleSize
member.summary: The largest shingle size to index the input with and create subfields for.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.Norms
member.summary: Whether field-length should be taken into account when scoring queries. Accepts true or false. This option configures the root field and shingle subfields, where its default is true. It does not configure the prefix subfield, where it it false.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.SearchAnalyzer
member.summary: The analyzer that should be used at search time on analyzed fields. Defaults to the analyzer setting.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.SearchQuoteAnalyzer
member.summary: The analyzer that should be used at search time when a phrase is encountered. Defaults to the search_analyzer setting.

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.TermVector
member.summary: Whether term vectors should be stored for an analyzed field. Defaults to no. This option configures the root field and shingle subfields, but not the prefix subfield.

member.name: T:OpenSearch.Client.ITextProperty
member.summary:
A field to index full-text values, such as the body of an email or the description of a product. These fields are analyzed in OpenSearch, by passing through an analyzer to convert the string into a list of individual terms before being indexed.
Text fields are not used for sorting and seldom used for aggregations

member.name: P:OpenSearch.Client.IProperty.Meta
member.summary:
Metadata attached to the field. This metadata is stored in but opaque to OpenSearch. It is only useful for multiple applications that work on the same indices to share meta information about fields such as units.
Field metadata enforces at most 5 entries, that keys have a length that is less than or equal to 20, and that values are strings whose length is less than or equal to 50.

member.summary: With forced awareness shard copies are NEVER allicated within the same attribute

member.summary: Assign the index to a node whose {attribute} has all of the comma-separated values.

member.summary: Assign the index to a node whose {attribute} has at least one of the comma-separated values.
